title: Riddick Moss
text:
Michael Carter Rallis (born October 11, 1989) is an American <a href="Professional%20wrestling">professional wrestler</a> better known by the <a href="ring%20name">ring name</a> Riddick Moss. He is currently signed to <a href="WWE">WWE</a>, where he performs on the <a href="SmackDown%20%28WWE%20brand%29">SmackDown</a> <a href="WWE%20brand%20extension">brand</a> under the ring name Madcap Moss.
Early life.
Rallis attended the <a href="University%20of%20Minnesota">University of Minnesota</a>, where he played for the <a href="Minnesota%20Golden%20Gophers%20football">Minnesota Golden Gophers football</a> team between 2008 and 2012. After graduating college, he attended a tryout camp with the <a href="Miami%20Dolphins">Miami Dolphins</a> but was not signed to a contract. In October 2013, Rallis attended a <a href="WWE">WWE</a> tryout after contacting <a href="Jim%20Ross">Jim Ross</a>.
Professional wrestling career.
WWE.
NXT (2014–2019).
Rallis signed a developmental contract with WWE in early 2014 and began training at the <a href="WWE%20Performance%20Center">WWE Performance Center</a>. He made his professional wrestling debut on December 18 at a <a href="NXT%20%28WWE%20brand%29">NXT</a> live event in <a href="Tampa%2C%20Florida">Tampa, Florida</a> under the ring name Digg Rawlis. He made his televised debut on the May 27, 2015, episode of "NXT", working as an <a href="job%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">enhancement talent</a> alongside <a href="Elias%20%28wrestler%29">Elias Samson</a> in a defeat to <a href="Blake%20and%20Murphy">Blake and Murphy</a>. Rawlis made further occasional televised appearances as an enhancement talent during 2015, losing to <a href="The%20Hype%20Bros">The Hype Bros</a> and <a href="Samoa%20Joe">Samoa Joe</a>. In August 2015 he adopted the new ring name Riddick Moss, a tribute to former <a href="NFL">NFL</a> player <a href="Randy%20Moss">Randy Moss</a>.
In October 2016, Moss began teaming with <a href="Tino%20Sabbatelli">Tino Sabbatelli</a>, (calling themselves the God Gifted Athletes) with the two competing in the 2016 <a href="Dusty%20Rhodes%20Tag%20Team%20Classic">Dusty Rhodes Tag Team Classic</a> where they were defeated in the first round by <a href="The%20Mighty%20Don%27t%20Kneel">TM61</a> on the October 12 episode of "<a href="WWE%20NXT">NXT</a>". Moss made a further appearance on the January 4, 2017, episode of "NXT", again teaming with Sabbatelli in a defeat to <a href="FTR%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">The Revival</a> (<a href="Cash%20Wheeler">Dash Wilder</a> and <a href="Dax%20Harwood">Scott Dawson</a>). Moss and Sabbatelli made another appearance on the May 10 episode of "NXT", losing to <a href="DIY%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">#DIY</a> (<a href="Johnny%20Gargano">Johnny Gargano</a> and <a href="Tommaso%20Ciampa">Tommaso Ciampa</a>). The duo had their first televised victory on the October 25 episode of "NXT", defeating the team of <a href="Oney%20Lorcan">Oney Lorcan</a> and <a href="Danny%20Burch">Danny Burch</a>. In early 2018, Moss and Sabbatelli entered the Dusty Rhodes Tag Team Classic losing to Sanity in the first round. On April 25 during a match with Heavy Machinery, Sabbatelli ditched Moss, thus ending the team. In May 2018, he tore his <a href="Achilles%20tendon">Achilles tendon</a> and would require several months to recuperate. He would make his return from injury on a November 30, 2018 live event, losing to <a href="Matt%20Riddle">Matt Riddle</a> after a surprise appearance. In March 2019, he started being managed by <a href="Robert%20Stone%20%28wrestler%29">Robert Strauss</a> at NXT live events. On the May 8, 2019 episode of NXT, Moss competed in his first televised match since his injury in a loss to <a href="Raul%20Mendoza">Raul Mendoza</a>.
Raw debut; 24/7 Champion (2020).
On the January 27, 2020 episode of "<a href="WWE%20Raw">Raw</a>", Moss made his main roster debut, accompanying <a href="Mojo%20Rawley">Mojo Rawley</a> to the ring for his <a href="WWE%2024/7%20Championship">WWE 24/7 Championship</a> match against <a href="No%20Way%20Jose%20%28wrestler%29">No Way Jose</a>, where Moss was billed as Rawley's 'offensive lineman'. Rawley lost the championship to <a href="R-Truth">R-Truth</a> right after defeating Jose. However, Moss assisted Rawley in regaining the title just seconds later. On the February 10 episode of "Raw", after losing a tag team match to <a href="The%20Street%20Profits">The Street Profits</a>, Moss turned on Rawley and pinned him to win the 24/7 Championship. Moss then retained his title against the likes of Rawley, Truth, <a href="Cedric%20Alexander">Cedric Alexander</a>, and <a href="Ricochet%20%28wrestler%29">Ricochet</a>. On March 22, Moss lost the title to Truth while out for a jog, ending his reign at 41 days. On the August 10 episode of Raw, Moss made his return in a Raw Underground segment, an underground fight club hosted by <a href="Shane%20McMahon">Shane McMahon</a>, where he defeated Cal Bloom by knockout. Moss suffered a <a href="torn%20ACL">torn ACL</a> in October.
Madcap Moss (2021–present).
After being out of action for an entire year, Moss returned from injury by defeating <a href="Odyssey%20Jones">Odyssey Jones</a> in a <a href="dark%20match">dark match</a> before the September 17, 2021 episode of "<a href="WWE%20SmackDown">SmackDown</a>". The following week on "SmackDown", Moss made his televised return by attacking <a href="Kevin%20Owens">Kevin Owens</a> and aligning with <a href="Baron%20Corbin">Happy Corbin</a>. The following week, his ring name was changed to Madcap Moss. Later, Corbin would defeat Owens in a singles match, and the two started to feud with the <a href="Shinsuke%20Nakamura">Shinsuke Nakamura</a> and <a href="Rick%20Boogs">Rick Boogs</a> with Corbin defeating Nakamura in a championship contenders match, and Moss and Corbin defeating Nakamura and Boogs in a street fight. Later, the two were defeated by <a href="The%20Viking%20Raiders">The Viking Raiders</a> by countout.
